item.title: What Does It Take To See Gentrification Before It Happens?
item.description: August 29, 2017 - The great hope of urban advocates is to democratize data, allowing residents to see more clearly how a neighborhood is changing — but knowledge of those changes may accelerate them, says Adam Frank.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 29, 2017 - The great hope of urban advocates is to democratize data, allowing residents to see more clearly how a neighborhood is changing — but knowledge of those changes may accelerate them, says Adam Frank. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/29/546980178/what-does-it-take-to-see-gentrification-before-it-happens

item.title: Trump Heads For Texas To Inspect Storm Damage
item.description: August 29, 2017 - The president says he waited to visit until he could do so "without causing disruption." He will sidestep Houston and instead visit the Corpus Christi area, where Harvey made landfall on Friday.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 29, 2017 - The president says he waited to visit until he could do so "without causing disruption." He will sidestep Houston and instead visit the Corpus Christi area, where Harvey made landfall on Friday. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/29/546861395/trump-heads-for-texas-to-inspect-storm-damage

item.title: Louisiana, Texas Prepare For More Rain From Tropical Storm Harvey
item.description: August 28, 2017 - Texas and Louisiana are steeling for more rain from now tropical storm Harvey. Rising temperatures factored into the size and impact of the storm.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 28, 2017 - Texas and Louisiana are steeling for more rain from now tropical storm Harvey. Rising temperatures factored into the size and impact of the storm. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/28/546862811/louisiana-texas-prepare-for-more-rain-from-tropical-storm-harvey

item.title: Hurricane Harvey's Size And Impact Points To Climate Change
item.description: August 28, 2017 - Hurricane Harvey bears the marks of climate change. Warmer waters in the Gulf of Mexico and rising sea levels make rain heavy storms like Harvey more likely in the future.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 28, 2017 - Hurricane Harvey bears the marks of climate change. Warmer waters in the Gulf of Mexico and rising sea levels make rain heavy storms like Harvey more likely in the future. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/28/546831731/hurricane-harveys-size-and-impact-points-to-climate-change

item.title: How A Warmer Climate Helped Shape Harvey
item.description:
August 28, 2017 - Rising temperatures factored into making the storm a watery giant, but other factors helped turn it into a catastrophe.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/28/546748502/how-a-warmer-climate-helped-shape-harvey
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: What Should We Be Teaching Young Children?
item.description: August 28, 2017 - Many things can be learned just as well later — so the focus should be on ones that really need to be early, like languages, music and communication, says psychologist Tania Lombrozo.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 28, 2017 - Many things can be learned just as well later — so the focus should be on ones that really need to be early, like languages, music and communication, says psychologist Tania Lombrozo. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/28/546811975/what-should-we-be-teaching-young-children

item.title: Harvey Hits Hard
item.description:
August 28, 2017 - Gulf Coast residents have been told to evacuate or ready themselves for torrential rain, high winds and flash flooding.
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-08-28/harvey-hits-hard
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Need A Happiness Boost? Spend Your Money To Buy Time, Not More Stuff
item.description: August 28, 2017 - A recent study suggests that when people spend their extra cash to get help with time-consuming chores, they're likelier to feel better than if they use the money to buy more things.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 28, 2017 - A recent study suggests that when people spend their extra cash to get help with time-consuming chores, they're likelier to feel better than if they use the money to buy more things. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/28/545839192/need-a-happiness-boost-spend-your-money-to-buy-time-not-more-stuff

item.title: Houston Mayor Sylvester Turner On Hurricane Harvey Preparedness
item.description:
August 27, 2017 - Michel Martin talks to Houston Mayor Sylvester Turner about the storm pummeling the region.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/08/27/546604737/houston-mayor-sylvester-turner-on-the-lead-up-to-hurricane-harvey

item.title: Coast Guard Update: Houston Search And Rescue Efforts
item.description: August 27, 2017 - NPR's Michel Martin talks to a representative from the U.S. Coast Guard, Captain Kevin D. Oditt, about the how the search and rescue efforts are going in the city of Houston.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Houston Weather Forecast Update
item.description:
August 27, 2017 - NPR's Michel Martin talks to meteorologist Eric Berger about the forecast for the city of Houston over the next few days.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/08/27/546603401/houston-weather-forecast-update

item.title: Meteorologist On Hurricane Historical Texas Damage
item.description: August 27, 2017 - Hurricane Harvey is causing much more damage than other hurricanes have in Texas. NPR's Michel Martin interviews Dr. Neil Frank, former director of the National Hurricane Center and longtime meteorologist, about why this storm is so bad.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 27, 2017 - Hurricane Harvey is causing much more damage than other hurricanes have in Texas. item.title: Eclipse 2017: One Nation Under The Sun
item.description:
August 27, 2017 - For many, witnessing the total solar eclipse on Monday, Aug. 21, 2017, was the event of a lifetime.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/08/27/546109041/eclipse-2017-one-nation-under-the-sun

item.title: The Consequences Of Anti-Vaccination In 'Keep You Safe'
item.description: August 27, 2017 - Host A Martinez talks with Melissa Hill about her new novel, Keep You Safe, a story which takes on the heated topic of childhood vaccinations and the tragic repercussions of a parent's decision.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 27, 2017 - Host A Martinez talks with Melissa Hill about her new novel, Keep You Safe, a story which takes on the heated topic of childhood vaccinations and the tragic repercussions of a parent's decision. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/27/546497351/the-consequences-of-anti-vaccination-in-keep-you-safe

item.title: As Houston-Area Suburbs Wait For Harvey To Blow Over, Temporary Fixes Abound
item.description: August 26, 2017 - In wealthy Sierra Plantation, crews are working hard to patch roofs and clear debris from downed trees. But it's all just a temporary solution until the storm's cycle brings more damage.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 26, 2017 - In wealthy Sierra Plantation, crews are working hard to patch roofs and clear debris from downed trees. But it's all just a temporary solution until the storm's cycle brings more damage. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/26/546406272/as-houston-area-suburbs-wait-for-harvey-to-blow-over-temporary-fixes-abound
